warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Rotate shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Clasp hands behind your back and gently straighten your arms, feeling a stretch in your chest. Hold for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Raise one arm overhead and bend at the elbow, letting your hand fall behind your head.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Gently push your elbow with your other hand, feeling a stretch in your triceps. Hold for 30 seconds per arm.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at your sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading your legs and raising your arms overhead. Return to starting position. Repeat for 1 minute.

exercises.setup: Adjust the machine seat so that your back is comfortably supported.  Position yourself so that when you grasp the handles, your arms are slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Ensure your elbows are slightly bent at the starting position.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably with your back against the backrest, feet flat on the floor. Grasp the handles with a slightly wider than shoulder-width grip.
2. The Press: Extend your arms fully, pushing the handles away from your chest. Keep your core engaged and maintain a controlled movement.
3. The Stretch: Slowly return the handles to your chest, feeling a deep stretch in your pectoral muscles.  Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.
4. Repeat: Continue the pressing motion for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on the mind-muscle connection.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, with an overhand grip. Lower the bar to your chest.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie supine on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower the bar to your chest.
2. The Press: Keeping your core engaged, press the bar upwards until your arms are fully extended.  Maintain a controlled movement throughout.
3. The Lowering: Slowly lower the bar back to your chest, maintaining control and feeling the stretch in your chest muscles. Pause briefly at the bottom.
4. Repeat: Continue the pressing motion for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid bouncing the weight.  Maintain a stable position throughout the exercise.

exercises.setup: Adjust the bench to an incline of approximately 30-45 degrees. Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, maintaining a neutral grip.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the incline bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. Lower the dumbbells to your chest.
2. The Press: Keeping your core engaged, press the dumbbells upwards until your arms are fully extended.  Maintain a controlled movement throughout.
3. The Lowering: Slowly lower the dumbbells back to your chest, maintaining control and feeling the stretch in your chest muscles. Pause briefly at the bottom.
4. Repeat: Continue the pressing motion for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the cable machine to a comfortable height. Sit on the seat, maintaining good posture. Grasp the handles with a neutral grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably with your back straight. Grasp the handles and extend your arms in front of you.
2. The Fly: Keeping your elbows slightly bent, slowly bring the handles together in front of your chest, squeezing your pectoral muscles at the peak contraction.
3. The Stretch: Slowly return the handles to the starting position, feeling a deep stretch in your chest muscles.
4. Repeat: Continue the fly motion for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on the mind-muscle connection.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid using momentum.  Maintain a stable position throughout the exercise.

exercises.setup: Sit on the seat of the cable fly machine, ensuring your back is straight and supported. Adjust the cable height to a comfortable level. Grasp the handles with a neutral grip.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit upright with your back straight and feet flat on the floor. Extend your arms forward, holding the handles.
2. The Fly: Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, slowly bring the handles together in front of your chest, squeezing your pectoral muscles at the peak contraction.
3. The Stretch: Slowly return the handles to the starting position, feeling a deep stretch in your chest muscles.
4. Repeat: Continue the fly motion for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on the mind-muscle connection.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie supine on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. Extend your arms to the sides.
2. The Fly: Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, slowly bring the dumbbells together above your chest, squeezing your pectoral muscles at the peak contraction.
3. The Stretch: Slowly return the dumbbells to the starting position, feeling a deep stretch in your chest muscles.
4. Repeat: Continue the fly motion for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on the mind-muscle connection.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid using momentum.  Maintain a stable position throughout the exercise.

exercises.setup: Adjust the cable machine to a low setting. Attach a straight bar to the cable. Stand facing away from the machine with your arms fully extended overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with your arms fully extended overhead, holding the straight bar. Your elbows should be slightly bent.
2. The Extension: Keeping your upper arms stationary, slowly lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows. Focus on feeling the stretch in your triceps.
3. The Contraction: Extend your arms back to the starting position, squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Continue the extension and contraction for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on the mind-muscle connection.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width. Extend your arms upwards.
2. The Lowering: Keeping your upper arms stationary, slowly lower the bar towards your forehead by bending your elbows.  Focus on feeling the stretch in your triceps.
3. The Extension: Extend your arms back to the starting position, squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Continue the lowering and extension for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on the mind-muscle connection.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement and avoid using momentum.  Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.

exercises.setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a close, overhand grip (slightly narrower than shoulder-width). Lower the bar to your chest.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie supine on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a close, overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart. Lower the bar to your chest.
2. The Press: Keeping your core engaged, press the bar upwards until your arms are fully extended.  Maintain a controlled movement throughout.
3. The Lowering: Slowly lower the bar back to your chest, maintaining control and feeling the stretch in your triceps. Pause briefly at the bottom.
4. Repeat: Continue the pressing motion for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on maintaining proper form and a controlled pace.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a straight bar to the low pulley of a cable machine. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grasp the straight bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. The Press Down: Keeping your upper arms close to your sides, extend your arms downwards, squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
3. The Return: Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control and feeling the stretch in your triceps.
4. Repeat: Continue the press down motion for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on the mind-muscle connection.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement and avoid using momentum.  Keep your elbows close to your sides throughout the exercise.

exercises.setup: Adjust the cable machine to a low setting. Attach a rope attachment to the cable. Stand facing away from the machine with your arms fully extended overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with your arms fully extended overhead, holding the rope attachment. Your elbows should be slightly bent.
2. The Extension: Keeping your upper arms stationary, slowly lower the rope behind your head by bending your elbows. Focus on feeling the stretch in your triceps.
3. The Contraction: Extend your arms back to the starting position, squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
4. Repeat: Continue the extension and contraction for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on the mind-muscle connection.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand. Lean forward slightly, supporting yourself with your other hand on a bench or your thigh.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand. Lean forward slightly, supporting yourself with your other hand on a bench or your thigh. Extend your arm downwards.
2. The Extension: Keeping your upper arm stationary, slowly extend your forearm upwards, squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
3. The Return: Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position, maintaining control and feeling the stretch in your triceps.
4. Repeat: Continue the extension and lowering for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a controlled pace and focusing on the mind-muscle connection.  Repeat on the other arm.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement and avoid using momentum.  Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
